file.name: amentum.space-global-magnet-1.0.1-swagger.yaml
file.content:
openapi: 3.0.0 info: contact: x-twitter: amentumspace description: > The World Magnetic Model calculates the intensity and direction of the Earth's magnetic field on a specific date-time, geodetic altitude, latitude, and longitude. It is relied upon throughout the world for navigation, mineral exploration, atmospheric and space science, and is installed on billions of devices.

A comprehensive description of the World Magnetic Model, including its limitations, can be found here.

We provide a RESTful API for free access to the out-of-cycle Wolrd Magnetic Model (WMM2015v2) valid for years 2015.0 - 2020.0.

The Global Magnet API wraps the original WMM code which is available here.

Amentum Pty Ltd is not responsible nor liable for any loss or damage of any sort incurred as the result of the use of the API.

The API is rate limited to 1000 calls per day. Contact team@amentum.space to discuss high volume annd enterprise support options.

Copyright Amentum Pty Ltd 2019. title: Global Magnet API - calculate main components of the geomagnetic field at or near Earth's surface version: 1.0.1 x-apisguru-categories: - location x-logo: url: https://twitter.com/amentumspace/profile_image?size=original x-origin: - format: swagger url: https://globalmagnet.amentum.space/api/swagger.json version: "2.0" x-providerName: amentum.space x-serviceName: global-magnet paths: /calculate_magnetic_field: get: description: > Declination (degrees) - angle in the horizontal plane between magnetic north and true north. Declination is positive when magnetic north is east of true north.
Magnetic inclination, or dip (degrees) - angle made between the horizontal plane and the magnetic field vector at some position. Positive inclination corresponds to a downward pointing magnetic field.
Geomagnetic Total Intensity (nano Teslas)
GV - Geomagnetic grid variation (deg) referenced to grid north. Grid north reference to 0 deg meridian of a polar stereographic projection. Only defined for latitudes greater than 55 degrees and less than -55 degrees (arctic and antarctic).
operationId: app.api.endpoints.GeoMag.calculate_magnetic_field parameters: - $ref: "#/components/parameters/Altitude" - $ref: "#/components/parameters/Latitude" - $ref: "#/components/parameters/Longitude" - $ref: "#/components/parameters/Year" responses: "200": description: Successful magnetic field intensity calculation content: application/json: schema: properties: declination: properties: data: type: number units: type: string type: object grid_variation: properties: data: type: number units: type: string type: object inclination: properties: data: type: number units: type: string type: object total_intensity: properties: data: type: number units: type: string type: object type: object summary: > Calculates the declination, inclination, total intensity, and grid variation at a point. tags: - Click to view documentation for API endpoints servers: - url: https://globalmagnet.amentum.space/api components: parameters: Altitude: description: Geodetic Altitude 0 to 600 (km). in: query name: altitude required: true schema: type: number Latitude: description: Geodetic Latitude. -90 (S) to 90 (N). in: query name: latitude required: true schema: type: number Longitude: description: Geodetic Longitude. -180 (W) to 180 (E). in: query name: longitude required: true schema: type: number Year: description: Year as a decimal in the range 2015-2020 (2017.5 would be half way through 2017) in: query name: year required: true schema: type: number
